result.execSummary:
The defendant Tavish England Cunning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1g.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges including the DNA surcharge.  By 12/31/2015.  Cash bail on deposit to apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Release for the Day Reporting Center with no limit on the number of hours.  Release for work, inmate work assignments and childcare only allowed up to 50 hours per week.  Credit for four days, 2/10/15 to 3/13/2015.

Provide a DNA sample if not already one.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the  court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tavish England Cunning

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; Release for The Day Reporting Center with no limit on the number of hours. Release for work, inmate work assignments, and child care only allowed up to 50 hours per week; credit for 4 days (2-10-2015 to 03-13-2015). 

- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, BY 12-31-2015. Cash bail on deposit shall apply. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. Any remaining cash bail shall be returned to the person who posted. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Letter on behalf of defendant received and filed. tk

Infomation file on 03-09-2015 as to Count Possession with intent to Deliver controlled Substance (Cocaine) (1 Gram or Less, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(1m)(cm)1g, 939.50(3)(g), 939.63(1)(b), a class G FELONY. Plea was entered on 03-09-2015 as to the Information filed.

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case proceeded to plea hearing.  
On motion of the State, Penalty enhancer, Use of a Dangerous Weapon dismissed.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.
From ADA Hauer received and filed. tk

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for motion hearing and final pretrial. Defense withdrew motion. Proceeded to final pretrial. Case remains in a jury trial posture. Jury trial remains calendared for May 27, 2015 at 9:00 am.
State's Witness List, State's Motion in Limine, and State's Proposed Jury Instructions, received and filed. tk
Defendant's Witness List and Defendant's Requeste Jury Instructions received and filed. tk
from ADA Hauer, received and filed. tk
Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence and Request for Evidentiary Hearing filed by Defense Attorney Michael Steinle and received.

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
For the reasons placed on the record Defense counsel requests additional time to file motions and for the case to be set for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial and Jury Trial. Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Copies given to state and defense counsel.  Case is adjourned for Motion Hearing and Final Pretrial Conference on 5-19-2015 at 1:30 p.m. and Jury Trial on 5-27-2015 at 9:00 a.m., Br. 17.
Any motions are due no later than 4-20-2015 by 5:00 p.m. and any written response is due no later than 5-11-2015 by 5:00 p.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 05:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record for the purposes of scheduling. For the reasons presented to the Court from the Defense the case is adjourned for Scheduling Conference on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17. 
Any motions are due no later than 4-9-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Calendar call scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Check Packet.

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle. Marissa Santiago for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP 
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 03-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Any additional cash bail posted on this case to be returned to the remittur.

As an additional condition of bail:
No dangerous weapons
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tavish England Cunning in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-039

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
Court ordered case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
